summary: This is a legal declaration from a custodian of records certifying the authenticity of business records provided to law enforcement. The records include an AT&T Wireless invoice from May 2004 for an account in the name of Jeffrey E. Epstein, submitted as part of an investigation by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: The AT&T Wireless invoice being certified is for an account in his name, indicating his phone records are part of the investigation.

keyFacts: An AT&T Wireless invoice dated May 5, 2004, for an account in Jeffrey Epstein's name was provided to law enforcement.
The document is a custodian of records declaration certifying the authenticity of business records under Federal Rules of Evidence 902(11) and 803(6).
The records were provided in connection with an investigation and prosecution by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The declarant asserts the records were made at or near the time of the events, kept in regular business activity, and made as a regular practice.
